detail_description: Praça Tiradentes in Ouro Preto is a bustling square located at the heart of the town. Named after Tiradentes, a prominent figure in Brazilian history, this square is adorned with two striking monuments at its opposite ends. The surrounding area offers an inviting selection of shops and cafes, making it a perfect spot to immerse yourself in the local culture.
name: Praça Tiradentes - Ouro Preto
address: MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Long-running museum dedicated to the casualties of a failed rebellion against Portugal in 1789.
detail_description: Museu da Inconfidência is a long-standing museum housed in the former municipal headquarters and old jail of Ouro Preto, dating back to 1784-1854. It pays tribute to the victims of the failed Inconfidencia Mineira movement, which sought independence from Portugal in 1789. The museum features exhibits such as Tiradentes' tomb and manuscripts related to the revolt.
name: Museu da Inconfidência
address: Praça Tiradentes, 139 - Centro Histórico, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Ouro Preto is a colonial town in the Serra do Espinhaço mountains of eastern Brazil. It’s known for its baroque architecture, including bridges, fountains and squares, and its steep, winding cobbled streets. Central Tiradentes Square is named after the martyr for Brazilian independence. There are numerous churches and chapels all over town, including the 18th-century St. Francis of Assisi Church.
detail_description: Ouro Preto, located in the Serra do Espinhaço mountains of eastern Brazil, is a charming colonial town renowned for its baroque architecture and picturesque cobblestone streets. The town features numerous bridges, fountains, and squares, with Central Tiradentes Square being a notable landmark. Ouro Preto is also home to several 18th-century churches and chapels, including the iconic St. Francis of Assisi Church.
name: Ouro Preto
address: State of Minas Gerais, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Revered Catholic church with a gold-plated, painted interior, plus displays of religious artifacts.
detail_description: Basílica Nossa Senhora do Pilar is a revered Catholic church located in Ouro Preto, Brazil. The church boasts a richly decorated interior covered with 400 pounds of gold and silver leaf. It features gold- and silver-clad sculptures, paintings by Bernardo Pires, and two massive angels made of solid silver.
name: Basílica Nossa Senhora do Pilar
address: Praça Monsenhor Castilho Barbosa, 17 - Pilar, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Museu Casa Guignard, established in 1987, is a tribute to Alberto da Veiga Guignard, a prominent Brazilian painter and designer of the 20th century. The museum takes visitors on a journey through Guignard's life, showcasing his artistic masterpieces and personal story. With three rooms dedicated to permanent exhibitions, the museum displays Guignard's paintings that reflect his deep affection for Brazil's landscapes, particularly Ouro Preto.
name: Museu Casa Guignard
address: Rua Conde de Bobadela, 110 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Cemitério da Ordem Terceira de São Francisco de Assis is located next to the Church of St. Francis of Assisi in Ouro Preto, designed by Aleijadinho. This cemetery was built near churches due to the ban on burying the dead inside them during colonial times. It is a place where only white and wealthy people from that era were buried, reflecting the respect for the deceased at that time.
name: Cemitério da Ordem Terceira de São Francisco de Assis
address: Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: 18th-century Roman Catholic church known for its design & lavishly painted interior.
detail_description: The Church of Saint Francis of Assisi is an 18th-century Roman Catholic church renowned for its exquisite design and lavishly painted interior. Constructed in 1768 by the celebrated Baroque artist Aleijadinho, it stands as one of Ouro Preto's most iconic architectural landmarks.
name: Church of Saint Francis of Assisi
address: Largo de Coimbra, s/n - Centro, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Mountain park with hiking trails, campgrounds & historic sites, plus a visitor's center & museum.
detail_description: Itacolomi State Park, located near Ouro Preto, offers a diverse range of natural and historical attractions. The park features the prominent Pico do Itacolomi, standing at 1,772 meters and serving as a significant landmark for former travelers. Visitors can explore various trails such as the chapel, lagoon, and oven trails while also visiting the dam and Mirante do Custodio.
name: Itacolomi State Park
address: BR-356, Km 98 - Bauxita, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Carmo, completed in 1776, showcases the final works of renowned Brazilian sculptor Aleijadinho. Originally designed by Aleijadinho's father and later enhanced by the artist himself, this church features rococo elements and soapstone sculptures of angels above its entrance. Frequented by Ouro Preto's high society when inaugurated, it also houses the only examples of decorative Portuguese tiles from that period in Minas Gerais.
name: Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Carmo
address: R. Costa Sena, 289 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled within the Federal University of Ouro Preto, the Museu da Farmácia is a captivating destination for anyone interested in the evolution of pharmacy and medicine from the 19th to 20th centuries. This museum showcases an impressive collection that includes preserved archives with notes from both local and European origins, alongside historical medical equipment and various medicines dating back to the 18th century.
name: Museu da Farmácia - UFOP
address: R. Costa Sena, 171 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Igreja de Nossa Senhora das Mercês e Perdões, also known as the Church of Merces de Baixo, is a beautiful colonial church located in Ouro Preto. Situated on top of a small hill and surrounded by steps leading to its entrance, this church was originally completed in 1772 and later rebuilt in the mid-19th century.
name: Igreja da Venerável Ordem Terceira de Nossa Senhora das Mercês e Perdões
address: Largo Musicista José dos Anjos Costa, 1 - 91, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Mina Du Veloso is a former gold mine featuring a 400-meter underground chamber supported by pillars. Visitors are guided through the mine to learn about Brazil's gold mining history, the techniques used by enslaved Africans, and the miners' daily lives and customs. Tours are available in Portuguese and English. The experience offers an insightful look into the reality of working in an old gold mine, with guides providing historical and geological information.
name: Mina Du Veloso
address: R. Levindo Inácio André, 400 - São Cristóvão, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Mina Chico Rei, also known as Encardideira, is a legendary gold mine located between Ouro Preto and Mariana. It offers visitors an underground adventure through its galleries and halls on a trolley once used by miners. The mine was owned by Chico Rei, a former slave who became king. Visitors can explore the deep shafts of the mine and even wade through an underground lake at Passagem Mines of 1719 for a thrilling experience.
name: Mina Chico Rei
address: R. Dom Silvério, 108 - Antônio Dias, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Paróquia e Santuário de Nossa Senhora da Conceição in Ouro Preto, MG is a must-visit for its stunning architecture from the Baroque period. Situated between Praca Barao de Queluz and Praca Antonio Dias, this church stands out as one of the country's finest architectural gems.
name: Paróquia e Santuário de Nossa Senhora da Conceição - Ouro Preto/MG
address: Pça Antônio Dias, 09 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Igreja de Nossa Senhora das Mercês e da Misericórdia
address: R. Padre Rolim, S/N - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Rosário dos Pretos is one of the many churches in Ouro Preto, each with its own unique history and architectural style. This church, dedicated to the Lady of the Rosary and also honoring Saint Iphigenia, was built between 1733 and 1785 in Antonio Dias. It is said to have been commissioned by Chico Rei, a former slave who became a wealthy mine owner and freed many others.
name: Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Rosário
address: Largo do Rosário, s/n - Bairro Rosário, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Basic dorms & private guestrooms in a villa with a communal kitchen & a TV lounge.
detail_description: Pousada São Francisco de Paula offers a range of accommodations, from basic dorms to private guestrooms, all within a villa featuring a communal kitchen and TV lounge. The pousada is located near the youngest church in Ouro Preto, which may show signs of wear on the outside but boasts well-preserved interiors with intricate decorations, beautiful paintings, and sculptures by renowned artist Aleijadinho.
name: Pousada São Francisco de Paula
address: R. Padre José Marcos Pena, 201 - Centro, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Capela de Nossa Senhora do Rosário de Padre Faria, also known as Capela do Padre Faria, is a small Catholic temple located in Ouro Preto, Brazil. It holds historical significance as the place where the city of Ouro Preto originated. The chapel features an external wooden bell and a pleasant surrounding area. Masses are held on Saturdays, but visitors can explore the chapel during the week.
name: Capela de Nossa Senhora do Rosário de Padre Faria
address: R. Padre Faria, 147 - Padre Faria, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Ouro Preto, the Igreja do Senhor Bom Jesus de Matosinhos e São Miguel e Almas is a captivating blend of history and artistry. This church, with its origins tracing back to around 1763 during the gold rush era, features an impressive portico crafted by Aleijadinho that dramatically depicts Saint Michael battling against the fires of hell, surrounded by souls from purgatory.
name: Igreja do Senhor Bom Jesus de Matosinhos e São Miguel e Almas
address: R. Alvarenga, 513 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Traditional dishes & homemade desserts are offered in this rustic venue set in a historic building.
detail_description: Restaurante Contos de Réis is a charming dining spot located in a historic building, offering traditional dishes and homemade desserts. Situated in the rustic charm of Ouro Preto, this restaurant provides a captivating culinary experience that delves into Brazil's rich heritage. The menu features skillfully prepared local specialties such as Local Sausage with Jilo and Braised Beef Ribs served with savory farofa and fried polenta, showcasing the essence of Minas Gerais cuisine.
name: Restaurante Contos de Réis
address: R. Camillo de Brito, 21 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Mina Jeje, located in Ouro Preto, Minas Gerais, is a fascinating historical site that offers insight into the gold cycle of colonial Brazil. This old gold mine played a significant role in the region's economy and is now a popular attraction for tourists interested in Brazil's mining history. The tour provides a comprehensive understanding of the manual labor and enslaved workforce that extracted close to 1,000 tons of gold from the mine. Cultural mediators enhance the experience by providing valuable insights.
name: Mina Jeje
address: R. Chico Rei, 371 - Alto da Cruz, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: If you're a cinema enthusiast visiting Ouro Preto, make sure to stop by Cinema Villa Rica Ouro Preto / UFOP. This charming venue is currently the only cinema in town and boasts a unique historical ambiance that adds character to your movie-watching experience. While it primarily screens films, it also hosts theater performances and various events for seated audiences, making it a cultural hub worth exploring. The location is quite convenient—especially if you happen to catch a bus nearby!
name: Cinema Villa Rica Ouro Preto / UFOP
address: R. Antônio Pereira, 3 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Vila Rica, now known as Ouro Preto, was once a thriving hub of gold mining operations in Minas Gerais. Its original name, meaning 'Rich Village,' reflects its history as a center of significant gold reserves during the eighteenth century. The Portuguese crown heavily invested in developing this area for gold mining. Today, it's worth visiting to explore its rich historical heritage and experience the remnants of its prosperous past.
name: Vila Rica
address: Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Rádio Itatiaia FM 89.3 de Ouro Preto is a popular radio station known for its well-organized studio and welcoming atmosphere. Visitors have praised the organized environment of the radio studio, highlighting the warm reception they received during their visit. Additionally, there are concerns about noise pollution caused by fast motorcycles at all hours of the day and night, impacting residents' quality of life.
name: Rádio Itatiaia FM 89.3 de Ouro Preto
address: Av. Juscelino Kubitscheck, 16 - Bauxita, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: R. São Francisco de Assis - Ouro Preto is a charming city with several notable churches, including the beautiful Igreja do Carmo in the city center, offering stunning views; the richly adorned Basilica of Pilar; and the masterpiece of baroque architecture, Igreja de São Francisco de Assis, featuring paintings by Mestre Athayde and carvings by Aleijadinho.
name: R. São Francisco de Assis - Ouro Preto
address: MG, 35400-135, Brazil

name: Tv. Santa Bárbara - Ouro Preto
address: MG, 35406-349, Brazil

detail_description: Exploring the Centro Histórico of Ouro Preto is akin to stepping back in time to the late 1700s and early 1800s, a period rich in Portuguese colonial history. This charming old town features cobblestone streets, stunning baroque churches, and beautifully preserved mansions that reflect its cultural heritage. A walking tour here can be moderately challenging due to elevation changes and uneven paths but offers an immersive experience near key attractions, including seven magnificent churches.
name: Centro Histórico - Ouro Preto
address: Praça Tiradentes - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Museum in a historic mansion displaying church oratories & images from the 17th–20th centuries.
detail_description: The Oratory Museum, also known as Museu do Oratorio, is housed in the Casa do Noviciado, a historic mansion where the renowned artist Aleijadinho once resided. The museum boasts an extensive collection of oratories, religious figurines, altars, and shrines dating from the 17th to the 20th centuries. These artifacts were brought to Brazil by Portuguese colonizers and have become integral to the region's cultural heritage.
name: Oratory Museum
address: Adro da Igreja do Carmo, 28 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Church of Santa Efigenia is a must-visit historical site in Brazil, known for its captivating history and stunning architecture. Situated atop a hill, the 18th-century church offers magnificent panoramic views of the city from its churchyard. Legend has it that the church was constructed by slaves, including one who would later be called Chico King. This iconic landmark provides visitors with an opportunity to delve into Brazil's rich history and is definitely worth exploring for its cultural significance and breathtaking vistas.
name: Church of Santa Efigenia
address: R. Santa Efigênia, 396 - Bairro Alto da Cruz, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Museu de Ciência e Técnica da Escola de Minas da UFOP is a must-visit in Ouro Preto. The building itself is impressive, and though it's well-maintained, some repairs are needed. The museum boasts excellent collections on natural history and mineralogy, showcasing a remarkable inventory of stones, ores, and gems. However, due to reduced funding for public universities, some exhibitions are no longer operational.
name: Museu de Ciência e Técnica da Escola de Minas da UFOP
address: R. Henri Gorceix, 20 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Museu Municipal Casa dos Inconfidentes is housed in a beautiful building located in Praca Tiradentes, with the statue of Tiradentes facing it. The museum, which was once the Municipal Chamber and Public Jail of the old Vila Rica, now holds the remains of some of the inconfidentes. While only thirteen of the twenty-four sentenced by the Portuguese crown have been found, an empty tombstone represents the others, including Tiradentes.
name: Museu Municipal Casa dos Inconfidentes
address: R. Eng. Corrêa, s/n - Vila Aparecida, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu do Aleijadinho is a museum located in Ouro Preto, Brazil, dedicated to the life and works of the renowned Brazilian sculptor Antônio Francisco Lisboa, also known as Aleijadinho. The museum showcases a collection of his sculptures, paintings, and architectural designs, providing visitors with insight into his artistic legacy. It offers an immersive experience into the Baroque art and architecture that characterizes the region.
name: Museu do Aleijadinho
address: Praça de Antônio Dias, 18, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Minas do Palácio Velho stands as a testament to the rich and often somber history of gold mining in Minas Gerais, particularly during the 18th century. Nestled at the foot of Tapanhuacanga Hill, this site offers visitors a glimpse into the original techniques used for gold extraction in Ouro Preto. Unlike more adventurous mines, this location emphasizes its historical significance.
name: Minas Do Palácio Velho
address: R. Dom Silvério, 159 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Casa Aleijadinho is a must-visit destination known for its stunning churches, including the Carmo Church and the Pilar Church, which is adorned with gold and holds the status of a Basilica. The Sao Francisco de Assis Church is considered a baroque masterpiece, featuring paintings by Mestre Athayde and carvings by Aleijadinho. This location was the first in Brazil to be designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site due to its historical significance.
name: Casa Aleijadinho
address: Pça Antônio Dias, 18 - Antônio Dias, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-192, Brazil

detail_description: The serene cascade of Waterfall 3 Drops offers a tranquil ambiance that soothes the senses. Its melodious tunes have an enchanting effect, rejuvenating one's inner being. This captivating tourist destination showcases nature's beauty in its purest form, with water gently descending in a harmonious rhythm. As visitors admire the breathtaking sight, they can't help but be captivated by its magnificence and allure.
name: Waterfall 3 Drops
address: Lavras Novas, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Forested park featuring several waterfalls & natural pools, plus a restaurant, BBQs & horse rides.
name: Parque Cachoeira das Andorinhas
address: Córrego José Pedro - Vale das Hortênsias, Alto Jequitibá - MG, 36976-000, Brazil

name: Palácio D'Ouro
address: R. Conselheiro Quintiliano, 627 - Lajes, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Morro São Sebastião Lookout, located in Ouro Preto, offers breathtaking panoramic views of Tiradentes square and the historical neighborhood of Antonio Dias. The best times to visit are early morning or late afternoon. Accessible by a steep street near the Astronomical Observatory, it's recommended to wear comfortable shoes for the climb. While some suggest hiring a local driver or taking a guided tour due to the challenging terrain, others find the view well worth the effort and recommend driving there directly.
name: Morro São Sebastião Lookout
address: Ladeira João de Paiva - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Tiradentes' Statue
address: Praça Tiradentes - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu de Arte Sacra de Ouro Preto is a must-visit in the charming town of Ouro Preto. For just R$10.00, you can explore this wonderful museum and its collection that will surely leave a lasting impression. The museum houses remarkable churches and offers an enriching experience without the need for a tour guide as all the information is available inside.
name: Museu de Arte Sacra de Ouro Preto
address: Praça Americo Lopes - Nossa Sra. Do Pilar, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Casa de Gonzaga is a must-visit place in Ouro Preto, offering stunning views of the fair, one of Aleijadinho's churches, and the city. Located in front of Igreja de Sao Francisco, it boasts the most beautiful window in Ouro Preto and offers free admission. Visitors can enjoy excerpts from Marilia de Dirceu on its walls, making it a delight for literature enthusiasts.
name: Casa de Gonzaga
address: R. Cláudio Manoel, 61 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Cachoeira dos Namorados
address: S/n, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Historic house-turned-museum with furniture,  documents & books from the 18th & 19th century.
detail_description: Casa dos Contos Museum, housed in an 18th-century building, was once a treasury house and temporary prison during the Inconfidencia Mineira revolution. The museum showcases furniture, documents, and books from the 18th and 19th centuries, offering insights into Brazil's history of gold and money. Visitors can explore rooms decorated to reflect their historical appearance and view a poignant exhibition featuring slave paraphernalia in the basement.
name: Casa dos Contos Museum
address: R. São José, 12 - Centro, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-066, Brazil

detail_description: The Mina de Ouro Santa Rita is a fascinating and captivating destination in Ouro Preto. It offers an incredible tour guided by knowledgeable individuals who provide insightful information about the mine's history. This remarkable site allows visitors to immerse themselves in the past, gaining a deep understanding of what life was like for miners during that time period. The mine's rich heritage and intense historical significance make it a must-visit location for those interested in exploring the depths of Brazil's mining industry.
name: Mina de Ouro Santa RIta
address: R. Santa Rita, 171 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Andorinhas Waterfall offers a simple and tranquil experience, with its sparse water flow possibly influenced by the dry weather conditions. Access to the waterfall is relatively easy, albeit with a fee of 25.00 reais per person. The picturesque waterfall boasts beautiful surroundings and refreshing water, although some might find the entrance price to be steep. Despite these minor obstacles, it remains an attractive destination for a day trip or outing.
name: Andorinhas Waterfall
address: Goiás, GO, 76600-000, Brazil

detail_description: The convention center at Arts and Convention Center UFOP is an extraordinary venue for hosting congresses or conferences in the captivating backdrop of a historical Brazilian city. It offers a range of spacious rooms, suitable for both small and large gatherings. This exceptional facility promises an unforgettable experience, setting the stage for life-changing events. Its impeccable structure and amenities make it a top choice for organizing conferences, ensuring a memorable and successful event.
name: Arts and Convention Center UFOP
address: Diogo de Vasconcelos, R. do Pilar, 328, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Tales of Vale Park
address: Trilha do Horto, 20a - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Museu Aberto Cidade Viva
address: R. São José, 132 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Cachoeira das Andorinhas
address: Ruas das Andorinhas - s / n, Morro São João, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

name: Chafariz Parietal
address: R. Antônio dos Santos, 85 - Santo Antonio Do Leite, Ouro Preto - MG, 35413-000, Brazil
